newsitem.title: CHINA: China to start to bond sale for Three Gorges.
newsitem.headline: China to start to bond sale for Three Gorges.

text.p: China will start to sell the first batch of one billion yuan corporate bonds for the gigantic Three Gorges Project on Friday, the Shanghai-based Business News said on Thursday.
The issue will last until March 18 and the bonds will be listed on the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges after the issue, the newspaper said.

The three-year bonds bear an annual coupon of 11 percent to be paid on maturity, but holders can transfer the bonds to others or use them as mortgages, it said. The bonds will be issued in bills of 100, 1,000 and 10,000 yuan.
At a meeting held in Beijing on Wednesday, Shenyin & Wanguo Securities, China's top brokerage, was selected as the lead underwriter for the issue, the newspaper said.
The bonds are open to all retail and institutional investors in China and will be available at selected sales outlets around the country, the Xinhua news agency said.
Proceeds will be used to offset a shortfall in investment funds for the dam project from 1996, the official agency said.
Total spending on the Three Gorges Project last year amounted to 8.2 billion yuan, it said.
